item.title: Still your grandfather's boiler
item.description: Notes Panel speaker during the “2023 Air Quality Seminar” for the Association of Environmental and Resource Economists at the Online Summer Workshop in Environment, Energy, and Transportation (AERE@OSWEET). See the working paper here.

item.title: Still your grandfather's boiler
item.description: Notes Panel speaker during the “Energy Transition” Parallel Session. See the working paper here.

item.title: COVID restrictions, federal assistance and small businesses
item.description: Notes Panel speaker during the “Pandemic Diseases and the Environment” Parallel Session. See the chapter in my dissertation here. Abstract This paper uses high-frequency data on electricity consumption to demonstrate the effect of COVID restrictions on business activity and the mitigating effects of federal support programs. Using hourly data from the population of commercial customers in a utility and a panel event study framework, we evaluate how COVID restrictions alter total electricity consumption, the time profile of when electricity is consumed, and the probability that an account shuts down.

item.title: COVID restrictions, federal assistance and small businesses
item.description: Notes Panel speaker during the “COVID-19 and Energy” Research Session. See the chapter in my dissertation here. Abstract This paper uses high-frequency data on electricity consumption to demonstrate the effect of COVID restrictions on business activity and the mitigating effects of federal support programs. Using hourly data from the population of commercial customers in a utility and a panel event study framework, we evaluate how COVID restrictions alter total electricity consumption, the time profile of when electricity is consumed, and the probability that an account shuts down.
